Scope: Responsible for Office Administration and administrative support

Head of a UN, NGO or local agency or office.  May include managing staff working in the country office; including assisting in the preparation of office work and cost plans and financial, human resources and administrative management.

Facilitates dialogue
and interaction between civilian
and military actors to better deliver humanitarian relief during a natural disaster or complex emergency.
Used For: Civ-Mil Officer; CMLO; Civil-Military Liaison Officer

Scope: Works in collaboration with the Cluster Coordinator in leading cluster-based activities during humanitarian operations.  Frequently co-chairs cluster coordination meetings and other activities.

Responsible for leading cluster-based activities during humanitarian operations.  Provides leadership and works on behalf of the cluster as a whole, facilitating all cluster activities and developing and maintaining a strategic vision and operational response plan.

Delivers core messages related to a humanitarian response using various communication tools, including social media tools, radio, television, print, the internet, videoconferencing and other new information technologies.
Used For: PIO, Communications / PI Officer; Press Information Officer
French Term: Spécialiste en communication et relations publiques

Scope: Inter-agency staff trained to advise on, facilitate and strengthen capacity and leadership of humanitarians to undertake and promote gender-sensitive programming to ensure the distinct needs of women, girls, boys and men of all ages and backgrounds, are taken into account in humanitarian action at global, regional, and country levels.  Frequently deploy to be hosted by the Humanitarian Coordinator's Office or a UN agency.
An official who is involved in public administration or government, through either election, appointment, selection, or employment.

Composed of members of organisations that are undertaking humanitarian action in-country and
that have committed to participate in coordination arrangements. These may include UN agencies, the International Organization for Migration, non-governmental organizations, and subject to
their individual mandates, components of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent
Movement.
Spanish Term: Miembro del Equipo Humanitario de un País

Scope: Manage information and data around the humanitarian programme cycle, including supporting common information processes such as preparedness, needs assessment, strategic planning, resource mobilization, implementation and monitoring.
French Term: Spécialiste de la gestion de l’information

Scope: Inter-agency staff  trained to advise on and support the strategic and operational humanitarian protection response for Displaced Persons and other vulnerable populations.
Organization's representative responsible for donating money, goods or other in-kind contributions.

Senior-most United Nations official in a country experiencing a humanitarian emergency. The Humanitarian Coordinator is appointed by the United Nations Emergency Relief Coordinator when a new emergency occurs or an existing humanitarian situation worsens in degree and/or complexity.
Member of an armed force or uniformed service who holds a position of authority.
Representatives of the UN funds and programmes, specialized agencies and other UN entities accredited to a given country designated to participate in the United Nations Country Team.
Designated representative of the UN Secretary-General assigned to lead the United Nations Country Team.
Manages all staff working in the field sub-office; including assisting in the preparation of office work and cost plans and financial, human resources and administrative management.
Assists senior management (potentially including the management of human and financial resources, ethics, investigation and audit, and management and analysis).
Used For: Head of Agency - Executive Assistant / Secretary

Scope: Individuals specifially trained as members of the United Nations Disaster Assessment and Coordination team in order to  deploy to disaster-affected locations upon the request of the United Nations Resident or Humanitarian Coordinator and/or the affected Government.
Used For: United Nations Disaster Assessment and Coordination Member

Scope: Cluster member who seeks to strategize and coordinate humanitarian activities between clusters.
Expert whose role is to provide information and guidance on environmental topics, including natural resource use, waste management, chemical pollution and energy provision.
